review_title: Too much talk of appreciation for employees but nothing in action & unfair Pay
pros: So many hard-working coworkers who care about the work they do.
cons: Incompetent management lack qualified for the job but they get high pay for doing nothing major. They are fully expert on how to create unnecessary high-paying positions and hiring some Directors, who never stay long term, which says a lot about the management of this Org.; not to mention the Board doesn't care what's going on and it's pretty useless to approach them. We tried and failed. Unstable HR Manager.

job_title: Community Support Worker in Victoria, BC
pros: There are some really solid coworkers.
cons: CEO has a capitalistic outlook for a nonprofit.

job_title: Mental Health Worker in Victoria, BC
cons: Not all employees are there for the clients. Management is overworked and underpayed

pros: Employees are nice people, supportive, and work under pressure almost always.
cons: Poor management, unjustifiable raise to management for doing terrible job, unfair pay rate to employees, so much cheap words to pretend they appreciate their employees but in reality they don't care. If it was up to the management, they would have possibly said to employees that you should provide services to the society for free.

review_title: Intense job depending on the site
job_title: Community Liaison Officer in Victoria, BC
cons: The fentanyl crisis was very hard to work through

job_title: Emergency Shelter Support Worker in Victoria, BC
pros: I had some decent coworkers and meals were free.
cons:
Overdoses, abuse on a daily basis.
Yelled at, have things thrown at you and called all the expletive's you can think of and management doesn't care. It's only if they damage company property that they care!

pros: Sense of accomplishment. Fed my Heart.
cons: Can be chaotic. Can be sad.

pros: Great people, who care. Providing a service to those in need.
cons: I can't think of any, right now.

review_title: Not recommended if you have life goals
job_title: Residential Support Worker in Victoria, BC
cons:
Dangerous work environment - clients run the show

Poor compensation for work that is expected

Unsafe working conditions - clients wants given priority over staff safety

job_title: Emergency Shelter Support Worker in Victoria, BC
pros: They took a chance and gave me an into this type of work in Victoria. They provide the best harm reduction support in Victoria. They are able to work around my erratic schedule.
cons: Dirty, full of tense situations, risk of needle stick. All the regular harm reduction shelter stuff.

job_title: Residential Support Worker in Victoria, BC
pros: Benefits especially, for the pension plan contributions.
cons: No benefits for part time employees
